entry.title: Re: How to check the outgoing message in the app Process...
entry.content:
1. Select the item and click "Show Communication Log".
  2. Open the HTTP message for outgoing communication.
  3. Click on XML to view the message.

3642804 - How to check the outgoing message in the app Process Payment Items for Invoices? - SAP for Me

entry.title: üá©üá™ Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and Generative AI Hub
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAP AI Core and Generative AI Hub. It is beneficial if you have some basic knowledge about JavaScript as we're using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI with the JavaScript variant.

This CodeJam introduces attendees to aspects of exposing generative artificial intelligence (genAI) capabilities to execute tasks using a given business context.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with the theory behind genAI, SAP AI Core, SAP AI Launchpad, and learn how to use the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model to expose AI capabilities through your own OData service.

While working through the exercises, you'll become comfortable creating CDS-based service definitions and integrating them into the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and SAP AI Core Foundation Models.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Tuesday September 16th, 2025 in Cologne, Germany üá©üá™ from 10:00 am - 4:00 pm. The workshop site will be the NEOMATIC AG office in Cologne Germany. The event will be held in english.

Thanks to NEOMATIC for hosting this event!

The instructor is the Developer Advocate @KRiedelsheimer 

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome.

Please note that seating is limited - we can accommodate 25-30 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Re: What's API to create billing items in commercial project
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

To create billing items in a commercial project using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you can use the API for Project Billing Request available on the SAP API Business Hub. API for Project Billing Request This API allows you to generate a Project Billing Request, which can include various contract types or usages, and is essential for managing billing items in commercial projects.

For more details, you can refer to the API Business Hub where you can find comprehensive documentation and examples on how to use this API effectively.

API for Project Billing Request

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Customer consignment process in SAP S4HANA with EWM a...
entry.content:
It depends on the Business requirement.  In standard, you need to create Consignment Issue order manually and if it is to be automated, couple of options are there

1. EDI Integration (Electronic Data Interchange)

  • Customers send consumption reports via EDI messages (e.g., IDoc type ORDERS05).
  • SAP receives the inbound message and automatically creates a sales order of type KE or CCIS.
  • This can trigger subsequent delivery and goods issue steps.

Go through this SAP Help portal

2. SAP Fiori App + Scheduled Job

  • Use the ‚ÄúManage Sales Orders‚Äù Fiori app to create consignment issue orders.
  • Combine with a custom Fiori app or background job that reads customer consumption data from a file or interface and creates orders via BAPI (BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2).

3. API-Based Integration

SAP S/4HANA exposes OData and SOAP APIs for sales order creation. You can explore on this.

entry.title: Re: Validation using External Hooks in SAP Sales Cloud V2
entry.content:
Hi @Harish_Singh 
I'm trying to do a similar functionality on the case entity. I have the below structure cds file

service CNS  @(path: '/ext/api/v1') {
      type object {}
      action processData(entity: String, beforeImage: object, currentImage: object, context: object) returns object
}
When I try to test via POSTMAN using the sample payload that is retrieved by generating the payload from case entity as shared by @arulraj_athiseharan, an error is returned mentioning that properties like id, displayId, etc., are not defined (400 - Error: Property "referenceProduct" does not exist in beforeImage/currentImage).
 
So, I generated the schema for case entity and defined all the properties and then test via POSTMAN and the it was successful. However, there seems to be an issue with actual properties between the generate schema vs what V2 sends for case entity, like isRecommendedCaseType, etc., were not part of the generated schema.
type object {
        id: String;
        displayId: String(35);
        ... (other properties)
       action processData(entity: String, beforeImage: object, currentImage: object, context: HookContext) returns HookResponse;
}
 
But as per your code it looks like you were able to achieve this without declaring all the properties, Am I missing anything?
 
 
Regards,
Harsha

entry.title: Re: From Application Logging to Cloud Logging: Service Innovation Guide
entry.content:
Dear Watchers, 

We posted updates to the blog post covering two important topics. 

Support for Cloud Foundry container metrics

  • SAP Cloud Logging supports Cloud Foundry container metrics as of Aug 2025 (see what's new section). CC: @akuller 

OpenSearch 2.x phased roll-out

  •  Since Jul 10 2025, we run Explore phase where users can opt-in to update to 2.x version. Read more in announcement in What's new section and https://me.sap.com/notes/3617458 for details and timeline. Start exploring OpenSearch 2.x and provide feedback.

Some of the other questions are answered via SNOW/Email - if not kindly post again. For questions regarding, guide on instance sharing and guide on roles, we aim to publish additional blog posts soon. We will update here after publishing.

Best Regards, Cloud Logging Team

entry.title: New Features and Fixes: Share Buttons, Notifications Feed, and More
entry.content:
We‚Äôve just rolled out the following improvements to the SAP Community platform, including one of the most highly demanded features from our feedback list. Read on to discover what has changed!

Share Buttons Now Available

Members have been asking for this feature for many months, and it‚Äôs finally here! You are now able to share content easily with the click of a button.

You have the option to share via email (letter icon) or directly to Bluesky or Linkedin. You can even copy the link if that‚Äôs your preference.

You‚Äôll find these buttons at the very bottom of the pages for blog posts, questions, discussions, events, and knowledge-base documents ‚Äì after the replies.

Fix for the Notifications Feed

If you use your notification feed to find new content in SAP Community, you may have noticed that when you clicked on the notifications button‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶you may have ended up looking at a long list of new activity ‚Äì with more notifications than a single page could handle. And if you scrolled down, you may have seen a spinning wheel, making you think that the page was loading.

Only it wasn‚Äôt.

Well, if you didn‚Äôt notice, other members did, and they let us know all about it, as shown in this feedback.

With this fix, the wheel is now gone, making it clearer that members need to click the ‚ÄúShow more‚Äù button to load more notifications.

Sort Options Added to Knowledge Bases

We had previously added sort features to a variety of activity feeds ‚Äì such as blog posts and discussions. We‚Äôve now introduced the same sort options for documents in our knowledge bases.

Within the activity area of a knowledge base, you can sort its documents by creation date, most recent, most viewed, most commented, and most liked.

More to Come!

That‚Äôs it for now, but we‚Äôre far from finished. We have several additional new improvements scheduled for later this month. Remember to keep an eye on What‚Äôs New for future announcements. Better yet, select ‚ÄúOptions‚Äù in the upper right of the What‚Äôs New section, then select ‚ÄúSubscribe,‚Äù so you‚Äôll never miss an update!

entry.title: Re: SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) ‚Äì Bank and Cost Center Replication from S/4HANA
entry.content:
@SachinDhingra Thank you for the feedback.
The postman credentials are created as service key from the MDI instance created for target testing. The Same is then also used for the pull distribution model setup.
For ease of using Postman, we first save the environment variables with the mdiUrl, xsuaaUrl, clientid, clientsecret, odmversion, odmentity.
Then we need to get the authorization token with POST call to the path - {{xsuaaUrl}}/oauth/token
Once the token is fetched, we can use that token to get the entries with the Get call to path:
{{mdiUrl}}/v1/odm/{{odmVersion}}/{{fullyQualifiedOdmEntityName}}/events

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Manage software collection which is exported by mistake with all items
entry.content:
Hi SAP Team,

User has exported software collection version with all items in it by mistake and got imported to Test system. This version has many items created by different users.

Only single item which consists in this software collection need to be moved to Production now and other items are not to be moved to production.

Please let us know how to manage this situation.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Manage software collection which is exported by mista...
entry.content:
In order to correct this you can simply discard the current version and either move the single item (and its dependencies) to a new collection or add it to a hotfix collection (HFC).

See the section for "Discard" in the following documentation:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/74940689b4a54c89a04f11dc2247701a.html

entry.title: Where can I configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Office) information?
entry.content:
The customer would like to know where they could configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Office) information. This information appears when checking the Inbound Delivery header details in the Warehouse Monitor APP.

In addition, they would like to know if when checking the inbound delivery item, the Owner and the Disposal Party (Party Entitled to Dispose) will be always the same.

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Where can I configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Offic...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

After setting the configuration activity 102657 (Set Warehouse Address), the Supply Chain Unit is created referred to: SCU_<WH No> with warehouse address (copied from plant address). This value is then set automatically and can appears for example in the Inbound Delivery header details in the Warehouse Monitor APP afterwards.

Regarding the second question, that's correct. Although the field is named as ‚ÄúOwner‚Äù, in our internal tables the technical field name is still ‚ÄúCustodian‚Äù. Therefore it still holds the information of warehouse owner but not the stock. 

To see more about Custodian field, please check: 

How can I configure the Supply chain unit, Party entitled to dispose, Custodian to EWM warehouse?

Best regards,

Geovana

entry.title: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after saving sales order?
entry.content:
The customer would like to know how can they avoid the system to always delete the confirmed quantity after saving the sales order.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after...
entry.content:
In the current system design, when you apply a delivery block at the header level of a sales order, the system automatically transfers the requested delivery quantity to all schedule lines. As part of this process, any previously confirmed quantity is removed, which can result in the confirmed quantity becoming zero.

If your intention is to keep the confirmed quantity unchanged, you may consider applying the delivery block at the schedule line level instead. In this case, the system does not reset the confirmed quantity.

For a detailed explanation of this behavior, you can consult the F1 Help for the delivery block field at both header and schedule line levels, where the differences are documented.

entry.title: Re: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after...
entry.content: Great answer!

entry.title: Re: No change number prompt while creating BOM in public...
entry.content:
Hello @Nody 

You can enable ECM for BOMs in S4HANA Public Cloud BOMs via SSCUI 201029, but you cannot set up an automatic change-number prompt; the user must manually select to work with ECM when creating or modifying a BOM.

SAP Useful documentation

  • Implementing Engineering Change Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Manage Bills of Material App-F4339

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP ByD. Customer Invoicing - Invoice Documents: add...
entry.content:
Hello @KCPN 

In SAP Business ByDesign, 0% VAT lines in Customer Invoicing ‚Üí Invoice Documents can't be hidden through configuration alone. Instead, you must filter them out in the list view using the tax code (for example, exclude V0) and save this view as either personal or shared. There is no system setting to completely hide these lines without impacting tax reporting.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Supply Chain Management Certification: Increase Your Expertise and Credibility
entry.content:
Running sustainable, resilient supply chains amid disruptions has become a driving force in many organizations. While supply chains have historically prioritized efficiency and cost reduction, digital technologies are delivering incredible gains to achieve even greater outcomes, while connecting processes and enabling faster insights.

In these times of rapid innovation, it‚Äôs becoming increasingly more critical to stay informed of the latest positioning guidance for SAP supply chain solutions. SAP has addressed this need by offering a non-technical certification option: Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management Solutions. The non-technical certifications options are designed to be completed in a matter of few hours, thus making it a great option for individuals who are new to certification, looking to replace an expired certification, or simply interested in cultivating expertise with selling SAP supply chain solutions. 

Becoming certified in SAP supply chain management solutions will prepare you to gain the confidence and trust in your biggest stakeholder, the Chief Operating Officer (‚ÄúCOO‚Äù). The self-paced learning content will cover these key areas:

  • The end-to-end solution portfolio and how it addresses key priorities for the COO
  • How to position Supply Chain Management solutions in the context of SAP Business Suite
  • How AI is being used today in modern business settings as well as how it fits into the SAP‚Äôs Business AI strategy.
  • Selling SAP Supply Chain Management solutions to the COO through qualification, discovery, and packaging. 

Upon completing the digital learning, your certification attainment is achieved by:

  • Successful completion of a one-hour exam that will include thirty questions derived from the self-paced learning content
  • Submission of one of the following hands-on exercises:
    • Articulating the value of SAP supply chain solutions through an executive pitch
    • Demonstrating the value of SAP supply chain solutions by performing a demo.

Don‚Äôt Delay‚Äîtake advantage of this opportunity to establish your credibility in SAP supply chain management and showcase your accomplishment. With around 5 hours of self-paced learning, this certification option is achievable for any busy professional and will provide tangible value in your field of expertise. Visit the SAP Learning Site to review the available certifications and select Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management so you can start expertly positioning SAP‚Äôs supply chain management solutions to solve your customer‚Äôs key challenges and deliver real-world results.

Lauren Edwards

SAP Industries & Experience, Partner Solution Enablement - Supply Chain Management

entry.title: Open Dataset, Update in Update Task and DB_COMMIT
entry.content:
Hello,

To increase the performance of a scan and update, I switched to the OPEN DATASET and FETCH with Package Size.

The update happens in an Update Task and then I use FM DB_COMMIT. However, I find the updates are not happening. After debugging, I find that the updates must not in done in Update Task.

I did some googling and I could not find any answers on why? Does anyone have a clue?

Regards, Dean.

Hi Anmol,

Since this is Managed RAP with unmanaged Save, you should also manage instance filter so that the RAP implements proper filtering to prevent inconsistent data reaching your Save method. 

projection;
strict ( 2 );

with managed instance filter;  <---this line should help

Let me know how this fares. @AnmolBhat 

Best,

Anitha

entry.title: Re: Certification not received
entry.content:
Hello @ABHINAV1402 

Here‚Äôs What You Can Do Fast

Double-check your SAP Universal ID setup

Make sure it‚Äôs active and linked to two valid email addresses (primary & recovery). Official guidance says that without this, the badge won‚Äôt be issued by learninghub.sap.com.

Confirm your exam is logged in the SAP Learning portal

Go to My Learning ‚Üí Certifications. If the exam isn‚Äôt listed, the issue is on SAP‚Äôs side, not Credly‚Äôs

Push again with SAP support, only this time, escalate

Log into the SAP Learning Help Center, choose Digital Badge as your service category, and include:

  • Your Case ID: 5000155124
  • Specific details: exam passed, date, score, and that the badge never arrived.

Prep Credly on your end

  • Make sure the email Credly is using matches your Universal ID email.
  • If not, add that email as a secondary in your Credly account and confirm it at SAP support.credly.com
  • You passed your C_TS4FI_2023 exam on 2 May 2025 with a 75% score and received your result email, but no badge or certificate has arrived, even after raising a support ticket (Case ID: 5000155124) on 4 May. That‚Äôs well beyond the usual 24‚Äì48-hour delivery window.

What's next to do

  • Verify that Universal ID has two working emails.
  • Check My Learning ‚Üí Certifications for your exam record.
  • Escalate with SAP, referencing your Case ID under the Digital Badge category.
  • Sync emails in Credly and submit a request if needed.

Let me know if you need further information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: PATCH Fails for Statistical Condition Types in API_SALES_ORDER_SRV
entry.content:
When attempting to update a Sales Order Pricing Element via the API_SALES_ORDER_SRV service using a PATCH request, the operation fails for certain condition types even though other condition types update successfully.

Example: Updating ConditionRateValue for a specific condition type fails, while other condition types in the same request succeed.

  • Error message: "Field CONDITIONTYPE is not an input field"

The issue occurs specifically when the condition type in the pricing procedure is marked as Statistical.

Has anyone encountered this behavior in the Public Cloud version of SAP S/4HANA? Is there a way to update Statistical condition types via API, or is there an official limitation?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: PATCH Fails for Statistical Condition Types in API_SA...
entry.content:
Yes, this is expected behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition due to how Statistical condition types are handled in pricing procedures.

Root Cause:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, if a condition type is flagged as Statistical in the pricing procedure, it is treated as informational only and does not influence net price calculations. As a result, Statistical condition types are read-only and cannot be updated via PATCH in API_SALES_ORDER_SRV or via the UI.

Resolution / Workarounds:

  1. Confirm in the pricing procedure that the condition type is marked as Statistical.
  2. Use a non-statistical condition type if you need it to be updateable.
  3. For manual adjustments, use the SAP Fiori Manage Sales Orders app.
  4. See SAP Note 2991011 for related API limitations.

I hope this helps!

Sap Support

entry.title: In CBAR Return Delivery, No FI Document is Generated
entry.content:
While using the CBAR standard Return Order type with reference to a billing document, the system creates the return order and delivery in the background.
After posting the goods receipt (PGR), the stock is placed in Blocked Stock.
We then move it to Unrestricted Stock using a stock transfer with movement type 343 E.

However, in the return delivery‚Äôs goods issue document, no FI document is generated.
Why is this happening and how can we generate an FI document for a return delivery ? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: In CBAR Return Delivery, No FI Document is Generated
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, movement type 343 E is designed for internal stock transfers (Blocked ‚Üí Unrestricted) and is not accounting-relevant.
This is standard system behavior, no FI document is expected for this movement type.

If you require an FI document during the return delivery process, the return must use an accounting-relevant movement type, such as 653, which posts returned goods to unrestricted-use stock and triggers FI postings upon PGR.

The movement type used in a return process is determined by the schedule line category in the return sales order:

  • WN ‚Üí Movement Type 653 (FI-relevant)

  • DN ‚Üí Movement Type 651 (typically to blocked stock)

You can change this in configuration activity Assign Schedule Line Categories (SSCUI 105642) to ensure the desired movement type is used.

Reference:
KBA 3563097 ‚Äì Movement Types in Sales Returns Process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
Customer Returns Processing Help Portal

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: I want "Display line item in general ledger" report f...
entry.content:
Hello @JabinRubayat 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Display Line Items in General Ledger app cannot send daily emails automatically.

The only common workaround is to create a Custom Analytical Query with the same data, then schedule it using the 'Schedule and Publish Reports' job template to send to the Business Inbox. Direct email delivery from this app is not supported.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Display item of content page on master page in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

It might only be static texts. But it might be useful to define the field

entry.title: Re: Integration Suite and Connection Type G for synchrono...
entry.content:
Hello @CodeMadeInGermany 

A type G HTTP/HTTPS destination in BD97 will not work for synchronous BAPI calls. ALE requires an RFC destination.
If you want to keep BD97, use an RFC Sender adapter in Integration Suite with a matching RFC destination (type T) in SM59. This way, the ABAP system sends a native RFC request that CPI can process.

With kind regards

Chuma
